channel.title: RSS Aggregator Feed
channel.description: An aggregated feed of Technology-related news

item.title: Trump orders federal agencies to drop Anthropic’s AI
item.description: On Friday afternoon, Donald Trump posted on Truth Social, accusing Anthropic, the AI company behind Claude, of attempting to "STRONG-ARM" the Pentagon and directing federal agencies to "IMMEDIATELY CEASE" use of its products. At issue is Anthropic CEO Dario Amodei's refusal of an updated agreement with the US military agreeing to "any lawful use" of […]...

item.title: Let’s Talk About the Ending of ‘Scream 7’
item.description: Who is Ghostface? What was their objective? Did any of it make sense? Let's dig in.

item.title: How to watch The Turkish Detective from anywhere – it's *FREE*
item.description: Here's how to watch The Turkish Detective online from anywhere in the world, completely FREE.

item.title: 'Modernizing a COBOL system once required armies of consultants spending years mapping workflows... AI changes this': Anthropic says AI could help keep COBOL running for a long time to come — but IBM won't be happy
item.description: AI now allows engineers to modernize complex COBOL systems efficiently, automating code analysis, testing, and incremental implementation for long-term operation.

item.title: Jupiter Mission Captures Rare Shot of Interstellar Comet 3I/Atlas on Its Way Out
item.description: The JUICE mission snapped photos of Comet 3I/Atlas after surviving its closest approach to the Sun.

item.title: The Best Roku Is $20 Off
item.description: The Roku Ultra isn’t just speedier, it also offers some advanced features that some viewers will find really handy.

item.title: The Tech Elite Aren’t on the Secret Guest List at Bohemian Grove: Report
item.description: A leaked list of Bohemian Grove camp attendee list shows some surprising guests and a noticeable absence of tech titans.

item.title: The Films and Shows You Should Be Streaming in March 2026
item.description: We've picked out the best horror, sci-fi, and genre titles coming to Netflix, Hulu, Disney+, and beyond.

item.title: AMD and Meta reveal massive GPU deployment news — 6GW of Instinct hardware set to massively boost Facebook owner's computing stack
item.description: AMD and Meta agree to deploy up to six gigawatts of Instinct GPUs, expanding AI infrastructure through multi-year hardware and equity alignment.

item.title: Interview : ce que le télescope James-Webb a vraiment révélé sur Uranus et ce qu'il laisse sans réponse
item.description: Pour compléter notre article récemment publié sur les nouvelles découvertes concernant l’atmosphère d’Uranus, nous avons eu l’opportunité d’interviewer Paola Tiranti, auteure de l’étude. Ses travaux apportent un éclairage sans précédent sur l'atmosphère de cette géante glacée, en explorant des...

item.title: The PS5 Pro is getting upgraded upscaling tech in March
item.description: After suggesting a version of AMD's FSR 4 could be ported to the PS5 Pro last year, it looks like Sony is finally rolling out an update with the upscaling tech in March. Mark Cerny, the lead architect of the PS4, PS5 and PS5 Pro, shared via a blog post that the PS5 Pro will be updated with a new version of the company's PSSR (PlayStation Spectral Super Resolution) upscaling tech next month, and Resident Evil Requiem is one of the first games to use it.PSSR is "an AI library that analyzes game images pixel by pixel as it upscales them," Cerny says, which boosts the visual fidelity of games on t...

item.title: I Never Would’ve Guessed the Skynet Problem Would Come Before the Mass Layoffs
item.description: You don't need to worry about AI taking your job during a nuclear apocalypse.

item.title: 'So big, it's basically a Start screen again': Windows 11's new Start menu is getting some hate — and triggering Windows 8 flashbacks
item.description: Windows 11's new Start menu is proving seriously divisive – some feel it's huge and badly designed, but there are fans too.

item.title: Google and OpenAI employees sign open letter in ‘solidarity’ with Anthropic
item.description: Hundreds of employees at Google and OpenAI have signed an open letter urging their companies to stand with Anthropic in its standoff with the Pentagon over military applications for AI tools like Claude. The letter, titled “We Will Not Be Divided,” calls on the leadership of both companies to “put aside their differences and stand together to continue to refuse the Department of War’s current demands for permission to use our models for domestic mass surveillance and autonomously killing people without human oversight.” These are two lines that Anthropic CEO Dario Amodei has said should not be...

item.title: Sam Altman Insists He Also Has Principles as Anthropic’s Pentagon Stand Off Continues
item.description: Bravely taking a position that won't get tested.

item.title: Musk bashes OpenAI in deposition, saying ‘nobody committed suicide because of Grok’
item.description: In his lawsuit against OpenAI, Musk touted xAI safety compared with ChatGPT. A few months later, xAI's Grok flooded X with nonconsensual nude images.

item.title: What's an E-Bike? California Wants You to Know
item.description: Cities want to stop kids from getting hurt. A lawmaker thinks warning them away from legal gray-area “e-motos” could help.
